metadata.title: CVE-2021-45868 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.15.3, fs/quota/quota_tree.c does not validatethe block number in the quota tree (on disk). This can, for example, leadto a kernel/locking/rwsem.c use-after-free if there is a corrupted quotafile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-aws - 4.15.0-1119.126~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1130-azure - 4.15.0-1130.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-gcp - 4.15.0-1115.129~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1086-oracle - 4.15.0-1086.94~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.129~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1086.94~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
